intro: Mammillaria bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It is characterized by its small, globular shape and a dense covering of white to yellowish spines. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, appearing in clusters at the top of the plant. Mammillaria bogotensis is a slow-growing species that requires minimal water and is well-suited to arid or semi-arid environments.
